main event: An orange, bright, and flashing object was tracked by radar for 4.5 minutes in Temple City, California.
interesting points: The object came up from the horizon to about 20 degrees elevation in 5 minutes, then remained motionless for 2-3 minutes before moving east at a slow speed.
The object was described as large compared to a star or planet and at a low altitude, estimated to be close to 6,000 feet.
The object was tracked by both ground visual and radar observation, with detailed radar data provided on its speed and altitude changes over the 4.5 minute duration.
Two military officers, Capt. Harry R. Sherrill and Lt. or Hoskim from intelligence, were involved in the investigation of the sighting.
The radar data indicates the object exhibited incredible speed, barely moving at times but with rapidly changing altitudes.
sighted object: one orange, bright, and flashing object
witnesses: civilians, including Capt. Harry R. Sherrill and an unidentified pilot
